info.title: General Ledger APIs
info.description:
# GL-REST-API
API documentation for **General Ledger** related screens provided by CMiC

_Note: These APIs can only be accessed if already a customer of CMiC._

tags.name: gltrialbalancebyacct
tags.description: GL Trial Balance Report by Account

parameters.name: fromAcctCode
parameters.description: Account Code to start search interval (gl2000)

parameters.name: toAcctCode
parameters.description: Account Code to end search interval (gl2000)

parameters.name: fromDeptCode
parameters.description: Department Code to start search interval (gl2000)

parameters.name: toDeptCode
parameters.description: Department Code to end search interval (gl2000)

AccConschartCode.description: Account Chart Code. Must be a valid Chart Code in CMiC.

AccTypeCode.description: Account Type. Must be a valid Account Type in CMiC (ie. A,L,O,R,E)

AccNormalBalCode.description: Normal Balance Code., D  Debit, C  Credit

AccSequence.description: Account Sequence. This is often the same as the Account Code. Must be within the sequence range of the Account Type.

AccSubledgCode.description: Sub ledger Control Code. (ie. If this is the sub ledger control account for Accounts Payable, we would enter AP here.)

AccSummaryCode.description: Sub Ledger Summary Code. Y or N. , Y  if the amounts posted to this account will be summarized in GL.

AccLongCode.description: Account Long Code is an alternate code. It is not displayed by any current programs.

AccCtrlCode.description: Controlling Account. Must be a valid Account. You will have to load this table one Account Level Code at a time. Leave null/blank if there is no control account.

AccLevelCode.description: Account Level Code. 1,2,3, (ie. Accnt 1000 = level 1, Accnt 1010 = level 2)

AccLowFlag.description: Low Flag. Y or N. , Y  if this is the lowest level account to which you will be posting transactions. (ie. Accnt 1010 is lowest level)

AccInterCompAccFlag.description: Inter Company Account Flag. Y or N.

AccHier.description: Account Hierarchy., System Generated  LEAVE THIS NULL

DeptCtrlCode.description: Controlling Department Code., Mandatory if DEPT_CODE is not 00.

DeptInterClearAccCode.description: Inter-Department Clearing Account. , Only populate if you are using Inter-departmental clearing. Otherwise leave null.

DeptIncomeCloseDeptCode.description: Income Closing Department. , Enter a valid department for Income Closing Transactions. (ie. 00)

DeptIncomeCloseAccCode.description: Income Closing Account. , Enter a valid GL Account. (ie. 3000)

DeptYr.description: Enter current year for this department.

DeptBuCode.description: Enter Business Unit Code. Populate with 00 if you do not use Business Units.

DeptCloseYr.description: Closed Year. Enter the last closed year for this department.

DeptBalanceFlag.description: Self-Balancing Flag. Set to Y or N. , Y if you wish to have automatic balancing transactions created for interdepartmental transactions.

DeptApTax1Code.description: AP Tax Code 1. Must be a valid Tax Code.

DeptApTax2Code.description: AP Tax Code 2. Must be a valid Tax Code.

DeptApTax3Code.description: AP Tax Code 3. Must be a valid Tax Code.

DeptConschartCode.description: Account Chart Code. Must be a valid Chart Code in CMiC.

GlNum.description: This is a unique transaction number applied to each transaction posted to the GL.  , For conversion purposes, this should be the same as the batch number (field 1)

GlCompCode.description: Must be a VALID CMiC company code

GlDsrcCompCode.description: This is the source company code, set this to equal the transaction company code

GlDeptCode.description: Must be a VALID CMiC department for the company code entered in field 2

GlAccCode.description: Must be a VALID CMiC account code for the company entered in field 2

GlJourCode.description: Must be a VALID CMiC Journal code.

GlBchNum.description: Start with batch number 1 and increment by 1 for each separate ASCII file created.  (i.e. 1, -2, -3)

GlSrcCode.description: This field is the Source Code of the transaction, i.e. if this transaction was created in AP this would be the vendor code, if created from AR this is the customer code.  If you are importing in summary format then this field should be set to something similar to SUMMARY BALANCE

GlSrcDesc.description: This field is the Source Description of the transaction, i.e. if this transaction was created in AP this would be the Vendor Name.  If you are importing in summary format then this field should be set to something similar to Summary Converted Data

GlRefCode.description: This is the Reference Code of the transaction, i.e. if this transaction was created via AP then this would be the AP Invoice Number.  If you are importing in summary format then this field should be similar to JUNE/03

GlRefDate.description: This is the reference/document date.  This is NOT the post date and does not have to be the same as the post date, i.e. If the transaction is from AP this date will be the invoice date, which in most cases is not the same as the post date.  If you are importing in summary method then set this date to the Period End date of the transaction.

GlPostDate.description: This is the POST Date.  This is the date the transaction will be considered entered in the GL.  If you are importing in summary method then this is the Period End date of the transaction.

GlRefDesc.description: This is the Reference Description field, i.e. if this transaction was created in AP this would be a short description of the invoice.  If you are importing in summary format then this field should be set to something similar to Converted Summary Balance June/97

GlAmt.description: This is the amount of the transaction.  This amount should not be zero or blank.

GlWmCode.description: This must be a VALID CMiC weight/measure code.  In almost all cases you will have defined default WM code for use in the GL insert this value.  (usually either LS or NA)

GlAdjYr.description: This field should be left blank if the transaction is not a YEAREND closing transaction.  If it is a YEAREND closing transaction then this field should contain the closing year in the format of YYYY (1997)

GlAdjPer.description: This field should be left blank if the transaction is not a YEAREND closing transaction.  If it is a YEAREND closing transaction then this field should contain the adjustment period number. (i.e. 13)

GlCurrCode.description: This is the company currency code, this must be set to the GL_COMP_CODE company currency code.

GlTavCode1.description: Transaction Allocation (TAC) code., If TAC codes are not being used leave this field blank, otherwise this must be a valid value for the TAC according to the pre-defined TAC rule

GlExchgCurrCode.description: This is the original currency code of the transaction.  For conversion purposes, this should be the same as the GL_CURR_CODE.

GlExchgRate.description: This is the conversion rate used to convert GL_EXCHG_AMT to the company currency  For conversion purposes this should be 1

GlExchgAmt.description: This is the Amount of the transaction in the originating currency.  For conversion this must be the same as the GL_AMT.

GlPyoverheadFlag.description: Set to Y,N,U. , Y - PY Overhead transaction. , N - NOT a PY Overhead Transaction. , U - Unknown transaction (not possible to determine if it's overhead or not - transaction was created before introducing flag). , For conversion purposes use N.

GenericError.description: An error occurred while attempting to retrieve, create, or delete record(s)
